_exec_summary.SummaryText:
United Agronomy

Donnybrook Plant-New

321 First Ave SE

Donnybrook, ND  58734



For further information contact Todd Erickson, Operations Manager, at 701-453-3384



A) The Facility Policy

The owners, management and employees of United Agronomy are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If any accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



B) Facility Information

The primary activity at the facility is the storage and distribution of fertilizer to farmers.

Anhydrous ammonia, used for crop production nutrients, is received, stored and distributed for direct application to soil.



C) The accidental release prevention program

The facility has implemented the provision of Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, published by the American National Standards Institute, Inc. and the Standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration, 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, as well as the requirements of the North Dakota Department of Agriculture Rules.



D) The five year accident history

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility.



E) The emergency response program

The facility has:

1) A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;

2) Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA Title III;

3) Coordinated with local emergency responders and the fire department.



F) Planned changes to improve safety

Safety improvement is an ongoing process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations as required by state and federal law are performed to assess the
condition of equipment and processes and improve it as needed.
